priority: P0 - Critical for Phase 3 Governor.sol audits

arxiv_queries.query_string: cat:cs.CR AND ti:"smart contract" AND (ti:security OR ti:verification) AND submittedDate:[2023 TO 2025]
cat:cs.CR AND ti:SoK AND abs:"smart contract" AND submittedDate:[2020 TO 2025]

papers.title: USCSA: Upgradeable Smart Contract Security Analysis
papers.abstract: We present USCSA, a tool for detecting security vulnerabilities in upgradeable smart contracts with 92.26% precision. Our approach combines static analysis with runtime verification to identify upgrade-related vulnerabilities including storage collisions, initialization flaws, and proxy delegation issues.
papers.notes: CRITICAL - Upgradeable contracts directly relevant to Governor.sol upgrade patterns. 92.26% precision = production-ready tool

papers.title: FLAMES: LLM-Based Invariant Synthesis for Smart Contract Security
papers.abstract: FLAMES leverages large language models to automatically synthesize invariants for smart contract verification, preventing 20.4% of real-world exploits in our evaluation. We demonstrate superior performance over rule-based approaches with 15.3% fewer false positives.
papers.notes: CRITICAL - LLM-based invariant generation for Governor.sol state invariants. Novel approach with strong empirical results

papers.title: Solvent: Formal Verification of Liquidity Properties in DeFi Protocols
papers.abstract: Solvent introduces a formal verification framework for proving liquidity properties in DeFi protocols using temporal logic. We verify 12 production protocols and identify 8 previously unknown liquidity manipulation vulnerabilities.
papers.notes: HIGH - Formal verification techniques applicable to Governor.sol treasury management functions

papers.title: Trace2Inv: Learning Invariants from Execution Traces
papers.abstract: Trace2Inv automatically learns program invariants from execution traces using symbolic regression and neural networks. Applied to smart contracts, our approach achieves 94.2% accuracy in invariant discovery with 40% reduction in verification time compared to manual specification.
papers.notes: HIGH - Automated invariant discovery from Governor.sol execution traces for test generation

papers.title: SmartCoder-R1: Secure Smart Contract Generation with Reinforcement Learning
papers.abstract: SmartCoder-R1 generates secure smart contracts from natural language specifications using reinforcement learning with security-aware rewards. Our model achieves 87.70% pass rate on security test suites, outperforming GPT-4 by 12.3% on vulnerability prevention.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Code generation less directly applicable but reinforcement learning approach interesting for fuzzing

papers.title: CrossLink: Cross-Chain Security Framework for Bridge Protocols
papers.abstract: CrossLink provides a formal security framework for cross-chain bridge protocols, including message verification, state consistency, and atomic rollback mechanisms. We prove security under Byzantine fault tolerance assumptions and implement a reference bridge with zero successful attacks in 6-month production deployment.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Cross-chain governance patterns relevant if DAO expands to multi-chain

papers.title: Reentrancy Attack Detection Using Control Flow Analysis
papers.abstract: We present a static analysis technique for detecting reentrancy vulnerabilities through control flow graph analysis and taint tracking. Our tool identifies 98.7% of known reentrancy attacks with only 2.1% false positives, outperforming existing commercial tools.
papers.notes: HIGH - Reentrancy detection critical for Governor.sol external calls (execute, queue)

papers.title: BitMLx: Extended Process Calculus for Smart Contract Verification
papers.abstract: BitMLx extends the BitML process calculus with support for complex contract interactions including partial execution, time-locked transactions, and oracle calls. We provide mechanized proofs of correctness in Coq and verify 15 real-world DeFi protocols.
papers.notes: HIGH - Process calculus for modeling Governor.sol proposal lifecycle with time locks

papers.title: Ponzi Scheme Detection in Smart Contracts Using Graph Neural Networks
papers.abstract: We apply graph neural networks to detect Ponzi schemes in smart contracts by analyzing transaction graphs and code patterns. Our model achieves 96.4% accuracy on a dataset of 2,847 verified Ponzi contracts with 3.2% false positive rate.
papers.notes: MEDIUM - Graph analysis techniques potentially applicable to governance attack detection

papers.title: Address Verification Vulnerabilities in ERC-20 Token Transfers
papers.abstract: We identify a class of vulnerabilities in ERC-20 token transfer logic related to address validation, affecting 142 contracts with combined TVL of $87M. Our analysis reveals systematic misuse of transfer return values and insufficient zero-address checks.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Address validation patterns applicable to Governor.sol token handling

papers.title: Symbolic Execution for Smart Contract Bug Detection with Z3
papers.abstract: We present a symbolic execution framework for Solidity smart contracts using the Z3 SMT solver. Our tool explores execution paths systematically, detecting integer overflows, division-by-zero, and assertion failures with 91.2% bug detection rate and 12-hour median verification time.
papers.notes: HIGH - Symbolic execution for Governor.sol path coverage and edge case detection

papers.title: Gas Optimization Patterns for Smart Contracts: A Systematic Study
papers.abstract: We conduct a systematic study of gas optimization patterns across 5,000 verified smart contracts, identifying 23 optimization categories that reduce gas costs by 18-45%. We provide a taxonomy and empirically validate each pattern's impact on security properties.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Gas optimization critical for Governor.sol proposal execution costs

papers.title: Timelock Security: Formal Analysis of Delayed Execution Patterns
papers.abstract: We provide formal analysis of timelock mechanisms in smart contracts, proving safety and liveness properties under various attack scenarios. Our framework models 8 timelock variants and identifies 3 previously unknown vulnerability classes affecting 67 production contracts.
papers.notes: CRITICAL - Timelock analysis directly applicable to Governor.sol proposal queue and execution delays

papers.title: Access Control Vulnerabilities in DAO Smart Contracts
papers.abstract: We analyze access control patterns in 234 DAO contracts, identifying 18 vulnerability patterns including role confusion, privilege escalation, and missing modifiers. Our study reveals that 42% of audited DAOs contain at least one access control flaw.
papers.notes: CRITICAL - Access control patterns for Governor.sol role-based permissions (proposer, executor, admin)

papers.title: Flash Loan Attack Taxonomy and Detection
papers.abstract: We present a comprehensive taxonomy of flash loan attacks categorizing 47 real-world exploits across 6 attack classes. Our machine learning classifier detects suspicious flash loan transactions with 93.8% precision, analyzing 2.3M transactions from 2020-2023.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Flash loan attack vectors potentially applicable to DAO treasury manipulation

papers.title: Fuzzing Smart Contracts with Grammar-Based Mutations
papers.abstract: We propose a grammar-based fuzzing approach for smart contracts that generates semantically valid transaction sequences. Our tool discovers 37 unique vulnerabilities across 150 contracts, achieving 2.3× higher code coverage than random fuzzing.
papers.notes: HIGH - Grammar-based fuzzing for Governor.sol proposal state machine transitions

papers.title: Slither++: Enhanced Static Analysis with Inter-Procedural Taint Tracking
papers.abstract: Slither++ extends the Slither static analyzer with inter-procedural taint tracking and context-sensitive analysis. We reduce false positives by 38% while discovering 12 zero-day vulnerabilities in audited contracts.
papers.notes: HIGH - Slither enhancements for Governor.sol static analysis pipeline

papers.title: MEV Attack Detection in Governance Protocols
papers.abstract: We analyze Miner Extractable Value (MEV) attacks targeting governance protocols, identifying 5 attack patterns including proposal frontrunning, vote manipulation, and execution sniping. Our detection system achieves 89.3% accuracy on historical governance transactions.
papers.notes: CRITICAL - MEV attacks on Governor.sol proposal execution and vote ordering

papers.title: Certora Prover: Industrial-Scale Formal Verification
papers.abstract: We present the Certora Prover, an industrial formal verification tool that has verified over 500 production smart contracts. Our approach combines symbolic execution, SMT solving, and modular verification, achieving median verification time of 8 minutes per contract.
papers.notes: HIGH - Industrial tool for Governor.sol formal specification and verification

papers.title: Upgradeable Proxy Patterns: Security Analysis
papers.abstract: We analyze 4 common upgradeable proxy patterns (Transparent, UUPS, Beacon, Diamond) for security properties including storage layout preservation, initialization safety, and delegatecall protection. Our study of 823 upgradeable contracts reveals 67 vulnerabilities.
papers.notes: HIGH - Proxy patterns for Governor.sol upgradeability via TimelockController

papers.title: DeFi Security: A Comprehensive Survey
papers.abstract: We survey 5 years of DeFi security research covering 156 papers, categorizing vulnerabilities into protocol-level, smart contract, and economic attack vectors. We propose a unified taxonomy and identify 8 research gaps including cross-protocol attacks and governance exploits.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Comprehensive survey for contextualizing Governor.sol security in DeFi ecosystem

papers.title: Runtime Verification of Smart Contracts with Temporal Properties
papers.abstract: We propose a runtime verification framework for smart contracts using Linear Temporal Logic (LTL) specifications. Our monitor detects property violations with 2.8% gas overhead and has prevented 14 attacks in production deployment across 6 months.
papers.notes: HIGH - Runtime monitoring for Governor.sol invariant enforcement during execution

papers.title: Blockchain Simulator for Security Testing
papers.abstract: We develop a high-fidelity blockchain simulator for security testing that replicates EVM semantics, consensus mechanisms, and network conditions. Our simulator enables 100× faster security testing compared to testnet deployment while maintaining 99.2% behavior fidelity.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Simulation for Governor.sol attack scenario testing under various network conditions

papers.title: State Machine Extraction from Smart Contracts
papers.abstract: We present an automated technique for extracting state machines from smart contract bytecode, enabling formal verification of state transition properties. Applied to 500 contracts, our tool achieves 91.7% accuracy in state machine reconstruction.
papers.notes: HIGH - State machine extraction for Governor.sol proposal lifecycle verification

papers.title: Mutation Testing for Smart Contracts
papers.abstract: We adapt mutation testing to smart contracts, defining 32 Solidity-specific mutation operators. Our empirical study of 150 contracts reveals that only 23% of test suites achieve >80% mutation score, indicating widespread inadequacy of existing tests.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Mutation testing for Governor.sol test suite quality assessment

papers.title: Smart Contract Optimization via IR-Level Transformations
papers.abstract: We propose optimization techniques at the Intermediate Representation (IR) level for smart contracts, achieving 22-38% gas reduction without compromising security. Our compiler pass applies 15 optimization patterns validated against formal security specifications.
papers.notes: MEDIUM - Optimization techniques for Governor.sol gas efficiency improvements

papers.title: Privacy-Preserving Voting Protocols for Blockchains
papers.abstract: We design zero-knowledge proof-based voting protocols that preserve voter privacy while maintaining verifiability on-chain. Our system supports 10,000 voters with 45-second proof generation time and 200K gas cost per vote.
papers.notes: MEDIUM-HIGH - Privacy-preserving voting extensions for Governor.sol (future work)

papers.title: Automated Exploit Generation for Smart Contracts
papers.abstract: We present sFuzz, an automated exploit generation tool that combines symbolic execution with reinforcement learning. Applied to 5,000 contracts, sFuzz discovers exploits for 156 vulnerabilities with median exploitation time of 8.3 minutes.
papers.notes: HIGH - Automated exploit generation for Governor.sol adversarial testing

papers.title: SoK: Root Cause of $1 Billion Loss in Smart Contract Real-World Attacks
papers.abstract: We analyze 50 severe real-world smart contract attacks (2022-2025) exceeding $1.09B in total losses. Introducing the concept of exploit chains, we propose a novel four-tier root-cause framework that moves beyond code-level vulnerabilities to examine design flaws, protocol interactions, and economic incentive misalignments. Our systematization reveals that 68% of attacks involved multiple vulnerabilities exploited sequentially, and 42% exploited cross-protocol composability assumptions.
papers.notes: CRITICAL - SoK analyzing $1B+ in real attacks with novel exploit chain framework. 68% multi-vulnerability chains directly applicable to Governor.sol compound attack scenarios. Four-tier framework provides structure for our threat modeling.

papers.title: SoK: Transaction Reordering Manipulations in DeFi
papers.abstract: We systematize mitigation approaches for transaction reordering attacks including front-running, back-running, and sandwich attacks in DeFi. Analyzing 12 proposed solutions (commit-reveal schemes, encrypted mempools, batch auctions, MEV auctions), we conclude that currently no scheme fully meets all demands of the blockchain ecosystem—privacy, fairness, and efficiency remain in tension. We propose an evaluation framework with 8 security and usability criteria.
papers.notes: HIGH - SoK on MEV mitigation strategies for governance transactions. Analysis of 12 solutions informs Governor.sol MEV protection (Flashbots integration, commit-reveal voting). Evaluation framework applicable to comparing governance MEV defenses.
